message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DL 

The paper presents a lightweight twitter crawler that targets language-specific communities of users and performs a complete crawl for all users, discovering many standard user relations. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Social and Behavioral Sciences (cs.SOC), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), and Digital Libraries (cs.DL). Among these, cs.SI and cs.SOC are the most likely categories as the paper focuses on exploring user relations and monitoring large communities of active users on Twitter. The paper also mentions mining collected tweets for analysis and further research, which aligns with the scope of cs.IR, cs.CL, and cs.DL.
